meanings.definition: To burn more intensely or longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: The bonfire was outburning all the other flames in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The candle outburning the others on the table flickered brightly.
meanings.sent3: The race to finish the marshmallows by outburning each other was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for dance outburning all other interests in her life.
meanings.sent5: The sun outburning the stars in the sky was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of burning more intensely or longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: The outburning of the wildfire left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The outburning of the furnace kept the house warm all night.
meanings.sent3: The outburning of the birthday candles set off the smoke alarm.
meanings.sent4: The outburning of the volcano was a terrifying spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The outburning of the engine's flames lit up the night sky.
